bug.summary: Cannot create Cortex cluster even though I have the permissions
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Version</denchmark-h>
0.18.1 <denchmark-h:h4>Description</denchmark-h>
I am trying to spin up the cluster with cortex cluster up. However I am getting the message <denchmark-code>[âœ–] AWS::EKS::Cluster/ControlPlane: CREATE_FAILED â€“Â "User: XXXXXXX is not authorized to perform: eks:CreateCluster on resource: XXXXXXXXXcluster/cortex (Service: AmazonEKS; Status Code: 403; Error Code: AccessDeniedException; Request ID: XXXXXXXX)" </denchmark-code>
My manager has given me all the permissions for eks in AWS. <denchmark-h:h4>Configuration</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code># cluster.yaml
# AWS credentials (if not specified, ~/.aws/credentials will be checked) (can be overridden by $AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and $AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY) aws_access_key_id: *** aws_secret_access_key: ***

# AWS region region: us-east-1

# minimum number of instances (must be >= 0) min_instances: 1
